Study in New Zealand: Your Gateway to World-Class Education from Pakistan

Study in New Zealand with EduCrest Migration, the leading Education Consultants in Islamabad, Pakistan. Through its services, EduCrest Migration helps aspiring Pakistani Students take advantage of some of the most exceptional study opportunities available abroad. If you want to pursue higher education in an innovative and vibrant education system with worldwide recognition, then New Zealand is one of the best countries to consider studying in. Located in the South Pacific Ocean, New Zealand has developed a rich and diverse Educational System that combines Research and Practical Application, providing students with the tools they need to start successful international careers.

New Zealand offers a range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs and Vocational Training Opportunities at competitive costs. Along with this, if you want to study in New Zealand, you will receive full assistance from EduCrest Migration every step of the way - from Application through to Visa Approval. Studying in New Zealand also allows you to transition from the hustle of Pakistan's cities to the peacefulness of university life. This will improve your academic profile and enhance your personal development.
World-Class Education

New Zealand’s universities offer high-quality and innovative degree programs. From IT to engineering and business, the study in New Zealand incorporate critical thinking and practical learning. In addition, New Zealand has universities that feature in the QS and Times Higher Education global rankings. The average rankings are from 60 to 250 including top 1% universities in the world.

Excellent Career Prospects

Study in New Zealand for Pakistani students offer careers in global industries, including technology, business, and healthcare. They can avail internships and placement opportunities leading to permanent employment. International students can work 20 hours per week part time and full-time during holiday periods. After graduation, students get up to three years of post-study work.

Research and Innovation

New Zealand is a global leader in Research & Development, with expertise in biotechnology, engineering, environment and other areas. Through its universities, New Zealand provides state-of-the-art research laboratories and projects for addressing current challenges facing society (e.g., climate change, sustainability). They give pathway for career progression.

How EduCrest Hub Can Help You?

At EduCrest Hub, we understand that the process of studying abroad can be overwhelming. That’s why we’re here to guide you every step of the way—from selecting the best program to assisting you with visa applications and housing arrangements. We begin with a one-on-one consultation to understand your academic interests, career goals, and financial situation. Based on your preferences, we will recommend the best programs and universities that align with your aspirations. After that, choosing the right university is a crucial decision.
We work with a wide network of French institutions, including some of the most prestigious universities and Grandes Écoles (elite institutions) in the country. Whether you want to study in Paris, Lyon, Toulouse, or any other city in France, we’ll help you find the perfect fit for your academic journey. The other steps include:

  • Research Programs and Universities
  • Prepare Your Documents
  • Apply to Universities
  • Pre-Departure Briefing
  • Secure Your Visa

Educational Consultation

Start by exploring the various universities and programs available in France. EduCrest Migration provides expert advice on selecting a program that suits your academic background and career goals.

Prepare Your Documents

You’ll need to gather essential documents like your academic transcripts, passport, Statement of Purpose (SOP), letters of recommendation, and proof of language proficiency (usually French or English). EduCrest Hub assists in making sure all your documents are in order.

Visa Application Assistance

Once you’ve chosen your program and university, it’s time to submit your application. EduCrest Migration will guide you through the submission process and ensure you meet all deadlines. Here are the requirements and perks:
Mostly 80% of universities won’t ask for IELTS and TOEFL, but few can ask.
Your CGPA must be above 2.5 or 60% marks in intermediate to study in France.
Scholarships up-to 4000 Euros are available.
Total admission processing time is 2 to 5 weeks.
You must have a valid passport to study in France.

Before you leave to study in France, we offer pre-departure briefings where we cover everything from the French education system to local customs and practical tips for living in France. This ensures you are fully prepared for your new life abroad.

After receiving your acceptance letter, the next step is to apply for a student visa. EduCrest Migration helps you with all aspects of the visa application, from completing forms to gathering required documents. You might need a bank statement of above 30 lacs minimum, it can be more.

What Makes France the Best Destination to Study Abroad?

France is synonymous with excellence in education, culture, and innovation. It offers top universities with quality education. Besides, the government of France is continuously taking steps to attract international students and enhance the exposure of France to higher education. You can do a part-time job and grab a post-study work visa for France. France is a hub of international courses and the latest techno-integrated curriculum is worth it to study in France. Here's why thousands of students from around the world, including Pakistan, choose France for their higher studies:

  • Document Check
  • Application Process
  • Assistance With Medicals
  • Visa     Processing
  • Language Coaching

What Makes France the Best Destination to Study Abroad?

France is synonymous with excellence in education, culture, and innovation. It offers top universities with quality education. Besides, the government of France is continuously taking steps to attract international students and enhance the exposure of France to higher education. You can do a part-time job and grab a post-study work visa for France. France is a hub of international courses and the latest techno-integrated curriculum is worth it to study in France. Here’s why thousands of students from around the world, including Pakistan, choose France for their higher studies:

Popular Study Programs and Universities in France

France offers a wide range of academic programs tailored to international students, whether you are looking for undergraduate, graduate, or doctoral studies. Here are some of the most sought-after fields for Pakistani students:

Program Type:

Bachelor’s Masters Ph.D. & Doctoral
3 years 1 or 2 years 3 to 4 years

Top Subjects and Universities

Popular Fields of Study Top Institutions
Arts ESSCA School of Management, France
Economics Berlin School of Business and Innovation, Paris
International Relations, Architecture, Political Science ICD Business School, Paris
Agriculture & Forestry EPITA – School of Engineering and Computer Science, Paris
Applied Sciences & Professions EM Normandie Business School, Paris
Arts, Design & Architecture Paris School of Business, Paris
Business & Management Kedge Business School
Computer Science & IT INSEEC Business School, Paris
Education & Training ESCE International Business School, Paris
Engineering and Technology ECE Engineering School, Paris
Environmental Studies & Earth Sciences SupdePub School of Creation and Communication, Paris
Hospitality, Leisure, & Sports HEIP, School of International and Political Studies, Paris
Humanities Schiller International University, Paris
Journalism & Media Montpellier Business School, Montpellier
Law Burgundy School of Business, Dijon
Medicine and Law Rennes School of Business
Natural Sciences & Mathematics Le Cordon Bleu, Paris
Social Sciences De Vinci Higher Education
  Istituto Marangoni Fashion and Design School, Paris

EduCrest Hub helps you choose the best program based on your career goals, and we assist you in the application process to make your dream of studying in France a reality.

Cost of Studying in France

Studying in France is surprisingly affordable. Here’s a breakdown of typical costs for international students:

Expense Category Estimated Cost per Year (in Euros)
Tuition Fees €6,000 – €12,000 (depending on the program at Public Universities for Bachelors)
€8,000 – €20,000 (depending on the program at Public Universities for Masters)
Accommodation €3,000 – €6,000 (per year, based on location)
Food and Living Expenses €2,000 – €3,000 per year
Transportation €300 – €600 per year
Miscellaneous €500 – €1,000

Note: These are average estimates and can vary depending on the city, lifestyle, and specific program.

Cost of Living in France: Budgeting for Your Stay

Living expenses in France can vary depending on the city. Paris, for example, is generally more expensive than smaller towns. However, with proper planning, you can manage your finances effectively.

Top Tips to Manage Your Living Expenses in France

  • • Accommodation: Consider student housing or shared apartments to reduce costs.
  • • Food: Save by shopping at local markets and preparing your own meals.
  • • Transportation: Utilize public transport and student discounts.

Living in France: What to Expect

Living in France as an international student is a unique and exciting experience. The lifestyle, food, and culture will enrich your studies, offering you an educational journey like no other.

1. Accommodation:

 

Student accommodation in France varies greatly depending on the city and your budget. From university dormitories to private apartments, EduCrest Hub helps you find a comfortable living arrangement that suits your needs.

 

2. Student Life:

 

France is home to a thriving student community, with international students from all over the world. With student clubs, cultural activities, and social events, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to meet new people and immerse yourself in French life.

 

3. Food and Dining:

 

From croissants and baguettes to cheese and wine, French cuisine is world-renowned. Students can enjoy affordable meals at university cafeterias or explore local markets and cafes.

 

4. Transport:

 

France has an excellent public transport system, with buses, trains, and metros connecting cities and towns. As a student, you’ll also be eligible for discounts on transportation, making it easy and affordable to explore the country.

 

5. Healthcare:

 

France offers an outstanding healthcare system. As a student, you’ll be covered by the French social security system, which provides access to healthcare services at a low cost.

 

Student Visa Process for France from Pakistan

To study in France, you’ll need to secure a student visa. EduCrest Hub provides step-by-step assistance to help you navigate this process smoothly:

Step 1: Choose Your Program

 

Select the program you wish to pursue and apply to a recognized French institution.

 

Step 2: Gather Documents

 

You will need several documents, including proof of enrollment, financial statements, passport-sized photos, and health insurance.

 

Step 3: Submit Your Visa Application

 

Submit your visa application at the French Embassy in Pakistan or through the Campus France website.

 

Step 4: Attend Visa Interview

 

You may be asked to attend a visa interview to discuss your study plans and intentions for returning to Pakistan after completing your studies.

 

Step 5: Receive Your Visa

 

Once approved, you will receive your student visa, which allows you to stay in France for the duration of your studies.

 

Working in France After Graduation

If you plan to work in France after studying there, the language can be one of the largest hurdles you will ever face. However, while you study in France, you can learn French in that time period. Learning this one language will help you speak with 270 million people in almost 30 countries of the world. Moreover, as France is one of the richest countries in Europe, the job opportunities are enough. But to find a job, you should be fluent in French. Therefore, while studying in France, it’s easier for the students to learn French and hunt for good jobs.

Start Your Journey Today with EduCrest Hub

At EduCrest Hub, we are committed to helping students from Pakistan achieve their academic dreams in France. With our expert guidance and personalized services, we ensure that your transition to studying in France is smooth, hassle-free, and successful.

Ready to take the next step in your education? Contact us today to schedule a free consultation, and let’s make your dream of studying in France a reality! Start your application process with us today. Whether you need help with choosing a program, preparing documents, or securing your visa, EduCrest Hub is your trusted partner.
